publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1221 Mr Michael McMahon: Steve Redgrave-That the Parliament notes the recent success of British Olympian Steve Redgrave; commends him on becoming the first Olympian to win gold at five successive Games in an endurance event; recognises his personal triumph in the face of illness, and sends warmest congratulations on behalf of the Scottish nation for bringing further sporting success to Britain.
S1M-1221 Steve Redgrave (lodged on 27 September 2000) Phil Gallie*

S1M-1221 Mr Michael McMahon: Steve Redgrave—That the Parliament notes the recent success of British Olympian Steve Redgrave; commends him on becoming the first Olympian to win gold at five successive Games in an endurance event; recognises his personal triumph in the face of illness, and sends warmest congratulations on behalf of the Scottish nation for bringing further sporting success to Britain. Supported by: Phil Gallie
S1M-1221 Steve Redgrave (lodged on 27 September 2000) Irene McGugan*, Donald Gorrie*, Maureen Macmillan*
S1M-1221 Steve Redgrave (lodged on 27 September 2000) Mr Brian Monteith*, Karen Whitefield*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*
S1M-1221 Steve Redgrave (lodged on 27 September 2000) Trish Godman*

S1M-1221 Mr Michael McMahon: Steve Redgrave—That the Parliament notes the recent success of British Olympian Steve Redgrave; commends him on becoming the first Olympian to win gold at five successive Games in an endurance event; recognises his personal triumph in the face of illness, and sends warmest congratulations on behalf of the Scottish nation for bringing further sporting success to Britain. Supported by: Phil Gallie, Irene McGugan, Donald Gorrie, Maureen Macmillan, Mr Brian Monteith, Karen Whitefield, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Trish Godman, Rhoda Grant*
S1M-1221 Steve Redgrave (lodged on 27 September 2000) Robin Harper*

Supported by: Phil Gallie, Irene McGugan, Donald Gorrie, Maureen Macmillan, Mr Brian Monteith, Karen Whitefield, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Trish Godman, Rhoda Grant, Robin Harper
